SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.json.mapping.deserialization

Interface ObjectMapper

All Superinterfaces:
Mapper, WritingMapper<ObjectMapper>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractObjectMapper, InvokeObjectMapper, ReflectionObjectMapper
public interface ObjectMapper extends WritingMapper<ObjectMapper>
Interface for mapping JSON objects to Java objects.

The ObjectMapper interface defines the contract for converting JSONObject instances and JSONArray instances into Java objects of specified types. It leverages a NameConverter to handle the transformation of field names according to a defined naming strategy (e.g., converting from snake_case to camelCase).

Implementations of this interface are responsible for handling the intricacies of JSON deserialization, ensuring type safety, and managing any necessary conversions or custom mappings between JSON structures and Java object fields. This interface extends WritingMapper, which allows for the inclusion of additional mapping configurations and customizations.

Key Features:

  • Conversion of JSONObject to single Java objects.
  • Conversion of JSONArray to arrays of Java objects.
  • Conversion of JSONArray to collections of Java objects with customizable collection types.
  • Support for custom naming strategies via NameConverter.
  • Handling of complex JSON structures and nested objects.

Example Usage:


 // Instantiate an ObjectMapper implementation
 ObjectMapper mapper = new JSONToObjectMapperImpl();

 // Example JSON data
 JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject();
 jsonObject.put("id", 1);
 jsonObject.put("name", "John Doe");

 // Deserialize JSONObject to a Java object
 MyClass myObject = mapper.toObject(jsonObject, MyClass.class);

 // Example JSON array
 JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray();
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject);
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject.clone().put("id", 2).put("name", "Jane Smith"));

 // Deserialize JSONArray to an array of Java objects
 MyClass[] myObjectsArray = mapper.toArray(jsonArray, MyClass[].class);

 // Deserialize JSONArray to a collection of Java objects
 List<MyClass> myObjectsList = mapper.toCollection(jsonArray, MyClass.class, ArrayList::new);

Exception Handling:

  • MappingException: Thrown when an error occurs during the mapping process, such as type mismatches, missing fields, or issues with the deserialization logic.
  • RuntimeException: Thrown for unexpected, critical errors that do not fall under MappingException. These typically include unchecked exceptions that arise from unforeseen issues.

Implementers should ensure that MappingException is thrown for known, recoverable issues related to mapping and deserialization, while reserving RuntimeException for unforeseen, critical errors.

See Also:
  • JSONObject
  • JSONArray
  • NameConverter
  • WritingMapper
  • MappingException

  • Method Details

    • toObject

      @NotNull <T> T toObject(@NotNull @NotNull JSONObject object, @NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type)
      Converts a JSONObject to an instance of the specified type.

      This method deserializes the provided JSONObject into a Java object of the specified type. It utilizes the configured NameConverter to map JSON field names to Java object fields according to the defined naming strategy.

      Example:

      
 JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject();
 jsonObject.put("id", 1);
 jsonObject.put("name", "John Doe");

 MyClass myObject = mapper.toObject(jsonObject, MyClass.class);
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the resulting object.
      Parameters:
      object - The JSON object to convert.
      type - The class type to convert the JSON object into.
      Returns:
      An instance of type T representing the converted JSON data.
      Throws:
      MappingException - If an error occurs during the conversion process, such as type mismatches or missing required fields.
      RuntimeException - If an unexpected error occurs that is not related to the mapping logic.

    • toArray

      @NotNull <T> T[] toArray(@NotNull @NotNull JSONArray array, @NotNull @NotNull Class<T[]> type)
      Converts a JSONArray to an array of the specified type.

      This method deserializes the provided JSONArray into an array of Java objects of the specified type. It iterates through each element in the JSON array, converting each JSONObject to an instance of the array's component type using the configured NameConverter.

      Example:

      
 JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray();
 JSONObject jsonObject1 = new JSONObject();
 jsonObject1.put("id", 1);
 jsonObject1.put("name", "John Doe");
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject1);

 JSONObject jsonObject2 = new JSONObject();
 jsonObject2.put("id", 2);
 jsonObject2.put("name", "Jane Smith");
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject2);

 MyClass[] myObjectsArray = mapper.toArray(jsonArray, MyClass[].class);
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the resulting array.
      Parameters:
      array - The JSON array to convert.
      type - The array class type to convert the JSON array into (e.g., MyClass[].class).
      Returns:
      An array of type T[] representing the converted JSON data.
      Throws:
      MappingException - If an error occurs during the conversion process, such as type mismatches or issues with individual array elements.
      RuntimeException - If an unexpected error occurs that is not related to the mapping logic.

    • toCollection

      @NotNull <T, C extends Collection<T>> C toCollection(@NotNull @NotNull JSONArray array, @NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type, @NotNull @NotNull Supplier<C> supplier)
      Converts a JSONArray to a Collection of the specified type.

      This method deserializes the provided JSONArray into a Collection of Java objects of the specified type. The supplier is used to instantiate the desired Collection implementation (e.g., ArrayList::new). Each element in the JSON array is converted to an instance of the collection's generic type using the configured NameConverter.

      Example:

      
 JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray();
 JSONObject jsonObject1 = new JSONObject();
 jsonObject1.put("id", 1);
 jsonObject1.put("name", "John Doe");
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject1);

 JSONObject jsonObject2 = new JSONObject();
 jsonObject2.put("id", 2);
 jsonObject2.put("name", "Jane Smith");
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject2);

 List<MyClass> myObjectsList = mapper.toCollection(jsonArray, MyClass.class, ArrayList::new);
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the resulting collection.
      C - The type of the Collection to return.
      Parameters:
      array - The JSON array to convert.
      type - The class type of the elements to convert each JSON object into.
      supplier - A Supplier providing instances of the desired Collection implementation.
      Returns:
      A Collection of type C containing instances of type T representing the converted JSON data.
      Throws:
      MappingException - If an error occurs during the conversion process, such as type mismatches or issues with individual array elements.
      RuntimeException - If an unexpected error occurs that is not related to the mapping logic.

    • getInstanceSupplier

      @NotNull @NotNull InstanceSupplier<JSONObject> getInstanceSupplier()
